column4: When I try to mount my hfs+ partition in ubuntu, I get this message: https://gist.github.com/387db3f005f5a636efd0
Can anyone help?
I have also installed hfsutils and tried "hmount" but that gives me errors as well
I suspect you don't have the hfs kernel module loaded
do you have a tutoril handy on how to do that?
not to hand, but there are plenty on the net, it's just a simple modprobe
please don't use the language you used last time
have you checked if the hfs kernel module is loaded as I suggested ?
no
what is the mount command your using ?
sudo mount hfsplus /dev/sdd1 /mount/point
sudo mount -t hfsplus -o rw /dev/sdd1 /mount/point
can you pastebin the output of "sudo fdisk -l /dev/sdd" please
I wonder if GPT partition format isn't enabled in the kernel
let me see if i can check...
just checked, it's supported
(well it's in my 10.04 kernel)
hfsplus support seems enabled by default too
that is what I have read, which is why this baffles me so badlt
agreed
that link only made my hdd read-only for ubuntu :(
